intro: Baudouinia sollyiformis, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Baudouinia sollyiformis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
